publicwhip.spmotion: * S3M-5771 Ross Finnie: Congratulations to Chris Paterson—That the Parliament congratulates Chris Paterson of Edinburgh, Gloucester and Gala Rugby clubs, already Scotland’s most capped rugby internationalist, on winning his 100th cap against Wales on Saturday 13 February 2010 and also congratulates him on his outstanding and record-breaking international career as a full back, stand off and wing, being first capped in 1999 and missing only five games in 11 seasons, playing in three World Cups and becoming Scotland’s highest ever points scorer, with 752 points, scoring 22 tries and kicking 153 penalties, 87 conversions and three drop goals. Supported by: Mike Pringle*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Rob Gibson*, Stuart McMillan*, Dr Richard Simpson*, John Lamont*, Tavish Scott*, Robin Harper*, Jim Hume*, Nigel Don*, Ken Macintosh*, Bill Kidd*, Nanette Milne*, Stewart Maxwell*, Kenneth Gibson*, David McLetchie*, Mary Mulligan*, Jim Tolson*, George Foulkes*, Elaine Smith*, Liam McArthur*
S3M-5771 Congratulations to Chris Paterson (lodged on 15 February 2010) Gil Paterson*
S3M-5771 Congratulations to Chris Paterson (lodged on 15 February 2010) Jamie Hepburn*, Sarah Boyack*
S3M-5771 Congratulations to Chris Paterson (lodged on 15 February 2010) Jack McConnell*
S3M-5771 Congratulations to Chris Paterson (lodged on 15 February 2010) Sandra White*
S3M-5771 Congratulations to Chris Paterson (lodged on 15 February 2010) Mr Frank McAveety*, Jackie Baillie*
